page.title: 05Ayston Footpath,2,Rutland
page.content: A parish boundary hedge (Ayston/Uppingham) crosses the path between Uppingham and the bypass.The western part of the hedge is discontinuous and is formed of hawthorn and elder.The hawthorn is especially interesting as some bushes share characteristics of both Midland Hawthorn and Common Hawthorn. Their flowers contained two styles and the leaves were small and deep cut.The eastern part of the hedge is dominated by elder. A small patch of ground between the footpath and the allotments contains vetches,stinging nettles,white dead nettle,bindweed and white campion.
